meanings.definition: To state or set forth the meaning of (a word, phrase, etc.).
meanings.sent1: She will def the new vocabulary words for the class.
meanings.sent2: Can you def the instructions for me, please?
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to def the concept of gravity using only hand gestures.
meanings.sent4: Her smile defed her happiness better than any words could.
meanings.sent5: He defed the rules of the game with such clarity that no one had any doubts.

meanings.definition: To explain the meaning of (a word, phrase, etc.).
meanings.sent1: He loves to def complex terms in a simple way.
meanings.sent2: Can you def the word 'metaphor' for me?
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to def the word 'serious' in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes defed her emotions more than her words ever could.
meanings.sent5: The teacher defed the scientific theory with a fun experiment.

meanings.definition: To describe or identify the nature or essential qualities of.
meanings.sent1: She will def the main characters in the story for you.
meanings.sent2: Can you def the taste of the cake you baked?
meanings.sent3: The artist tried to def the color blue to a blindfolded audience.
meanings.sent4: His actions defed his character more than his words did.
meanings.sent5: The chef defed the dish with such detail that it made everyone's mouth water.

meanings.definition: To determine or fix the boundaries or extent of.
meanings.sent1: The surveyor will def the property lines for the new construction.
meanings.sent2: Can you def the limits of your responsibilities in this project?
meanings.sent3: The kids tried to def the boundaries of their imaginary kingdom.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter defed the joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The ruler defed the length of the table with precision.
